marketNews.title: Purbaya Revises Upward Q4'25 Economic Growth Projection & Opens Opportunity to Lower VAT
marketNews.content: Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, said on Tuesday (10/14) that economic growth could reach +5.67% YoY in Q4'25, higher than the previous projection delivered by Purbaya last week at the level of +5.5%. According to Purbaya, the acceleration of economic growth in Q4'25 - which will be driven by new stimulus to be announced soon by the government - can boost inflows, thus the rupiah exchange rate is likely to strengthen. At the end of September 2025, the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, told the Financial Times that the government is planning a stimulus worth 2 billion US dollars (equivalent to ~33 trillion rupiah) to boost consumer spending during the Christmas and New Year holiday period. The last stimulus provided by the government was a stimulus worth 16.2 trillion rupiah announced in mid-September 2025. For 2026 itself, the government will launch several fiscal incentive schemes as follows: Extension of 100% DTP VAT for property until 2027 to maintain middle-class purchasing power and support the property sector which has a large multiplier effect. Under this scheme, the government will fully bear the VAT on the purchase of ready-to-occupy new homes with a maximum selling price of 2 billion rupiah. As for property with prices around 2-5 billion rupiah, the VAT exemption only applies to the first 2 billion rupiah. Not increasing excise duty and the Retail Selling Price (HJE) of cigarettes to maintain price stability and industry burden amidst economic recovery. Additionally, Purbaya also said that the government is opening the opportunity to lower the Value Added Tax (VAT) rate in 2026. Currently, the effective VAT for general goods and services is at the 11% level. Purbaya added that this discourse is not yet final, but a reduction in the VAT rate is possible if the economy and state revenue are in good condition. Previously, Purbaya projected that the Indonesian economy would accelerate further next year where growth could reach +6% YoY in 2H26.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Although Purbaya provided a projection for economic growth acceleration starting in Q4'25 since last week, this still seems unable to draw back foreign investor interest in the Indonesian stock market. In the last week, foreign investors have still recorded a net outflow of 4.1 trillion rupiah in the IHSG regular market. We assess that signs of economic acceleration realization are needed before the foreign outflow trend can reverse.

marketNews.title: International Monetary Fund (IMF) revises up Indonesia's growth projection for 2025 and 2026
marketNews.content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) in its latest outlook in October 2025 revised up Indonesia's growth projection for 2025 and 2026 to +4.9% YoY each, compared to the July 2025 outlook at the +4.8% YoY level. The IMF also revised up the global economic growth projection for 2025 to +3.2% YoY (vs. July 2025 outlook: +3% YoY), while the global economic growth projection for 2026 remains at the +3.1% YoY level.

marketNews.title: Indonesia officially reopens the carbon credit market to foreign buyers
marketNews.content: Indonesia officially reopened the carbon credit market for foreign buyers through the issuance of Presidential Regulation No. 110/2025, ending the uncertainty that had hampered the development of Indonesia's carbon economy sector. Bloomberg reports that the latest regulation allows carbon credits originating from emission reduction projects in Indonesia to be sold to international buyers who voluntarily wish to reduce their emissions. Previously, Indonesia halted the sale of new carbon credits to international buyers because it was reviewing the role of carbon absorption in achieving national climate targets.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Subianto officially issues waste-to-energy regulation
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto officially issued a regulation on the management of waste into electricity (PSEL) or waste-to-energy through Presidential Regulation (Perpres) No. 109/2025 signed on October 10, 2025. This regulation stipulates that Danantara will be the party that selects the business entity for managing PSEL waste management and carries out investments in the implementation of PSEL, while PT PLN is assigned to purchase the electricity generated by PSEL. This regulation also stipulates that the purchase price of electricity by PT PLN is set at 0.20 US dollars per kWh for all capacities, but in certain circumstances, this price can still be reviewed by the minister in the energy sector. The term of the electricity sale and purchase agreement is 30 years calculated from the date PSEL commences commercial operations.

tickerNews.title: GIAA Shareholders Approve Board Restructuring, Appointing Glenny Kairupan as President Director
tickerNews.content: GIAA: Garuda Indonesia shareholders on Wednesday (10/15) approved changes to the board of directors and commissioners. In this decision, Glenny Kairupan - a retired high-ranking TNI AD officer who previously served as a company commissioner - was appointed as President Director, replacing Wamildan Tsani who had only served since November 2024. In addition, Thomas Sugiarto Oentoro was appointed as Deputy President Director, Neil Mills as Transformation Director, and Balagopal Kunduvara - former vice president of the financial services division at Singapore Airlines Ltd. - as Finance Director. The Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGMS) also appointed Frans Dicky Tamara as a new company commissioner.

tickerNews.title: DKFT Plans to Distribute 2025 Interim Dividend of IDR 25 per Share
tickerNews.content: DKFT: Central Omega Resources plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to 25 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~3.2% as of Wednesday (10/15). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is October 23, 2025, while payment is on October 30, 2025.

tickerNews.title: TOTL Lands New Contracts Worth IDR 2.59 Trillion in 9M25, Targets IDR 5 Trillion for Annual Goal
tickerNews.content: TOTL: The Corporate Secretary of Total Bangun Persada, Anggie S. Sidharta, told Kontan that the company recorded new contract value of 2.59 trillion rupiah during 9M25, equivalent to 51.8% of the 2025 target of 5 trillion rupiah. Anggie stated that they remain optimistic about achieving the revenue and new contract value targets for 2025, set at 3.5 trillion rupiah and 5 trillion rupiah respectively. Meanwhile, Anggie mentioned that TOTL has revised up its 2025 net profit target from 265 billion rupiah to 295 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: INTP's 9M25 Cement Sales Volume Drops 4% YoY Due to Bag Segment Pricing Discipline and Project Halts
tickerNews.content: INTP: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa recorded a decline in cement sales volume of -7% YoY in 3Q25, resulting in sales volume weakening -4% YoY during 9M25 (vs. 9M24: +9% YoY). INTP's market share decreased to 29.3% during 9M25 (vs. 9M24: 29.7%), in line with the more moderate industry-wide sales volume decline (-3% YoY vs. 9M24: +2% YoY). INTP management attributed the volume decline to the pricing discipline strategy in the bag segment, as well as the cessation of bulk (bag) cement supply to the Patimban and IKN projects. Furthermore, INTP management stated that the company has renewed the lease agreement with PT Semen Bosowa for the next 2 years, while acquiring the Siawung terminal in South Sulawesi to strengthen distribution to the Eastern Indonesia region.

tickerNews.title: ASRI's 9M25 Marketing Sales Reaches IDR 2.1 Trillion, Driven by Residential Segment
tickerNews.content: ASRI: Alam Sutera Realty recorded marketing sales of 711 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (-35% YoY, +10% QoQ). This result brought marketing sales during 9M25 to 2.1 trillion rupiah (-9% YoY), equivalent to ~60% of the 2025 target of 3.5 trillion rupiah. The residential segment contributed 67% of marketing sales during 9M25, largely supported by landed houses (61%). Meanwhile, the remaining (33%) was contributed by sales in the commercial segment, mainly commercial land sales (29%).

tickerNews.title: PLIN Plans Interim Dividend Distribution of IDR 269 Billion or IDR 76 per Share for 2025
tickerNews.content: PLIN: Plaza Indonesia Realty plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to ~269 billion rupiah or 76 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of ~3% as of Wednesday (10/15). The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiated market is October 22, 2025, while payment is on October 31, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bes Trust Pte. Ltd. Sells Stake in CBRE; Andry Hakim Increases Holdings
tickerNews.content: CBRE: Cakra Buana Resources Energi shareholder, Bes Trust Pte. Ltd., sold ~253 million CBRE shares at an average price of 750 rupiah per share on October 10, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~190 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Bes Trust Pte. Ltd.'s ownership in CBRE decreased from 7.54% to 1.87%. Meanwhile, CBRE shareholder, Andry Hakim, purchased ~110 million CBRE shares at an average price of 750 rupiah per share on October 10, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~82 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Andry Hakim's ownership in CBRE increased from 2.57% to 5%.

tickerNews.title: Danantara CIO Pandu Sjahrir Expects 120 Companies to Join Waste-to-Energy Bidding Process
tickerNews.content: CIO of Danantara, Pandu Sjahrir, told Bloomberg that around 120 companies are likely to follow the bidding process for waste-to-energy projects. Danantara itself targets to develop 33 waste-to-energy projects in Indonesia. Pandu mentioned that the bidding process for these projects will be finalized in the next 6-8 weeks.

tickerNews.title: Danantara CEO Rosan Roeslani Projects Annual BUMN Dividend Increase to USD 10 Billion within 5 Years
tickerNews.content: CEO of Danantara, Rosan Roeslani, said on Tuesday (10/14) that they project annual dividends from State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) will increase from 7 billion US dollars in 2025 to 10 billion US dollars in the next 5 years. With this projection, Rosan stated that Danantara can invest up to 40 billion US dollars purely from equity. If debt is used to increase investment, Rosan mentioned Danantara's investment capacity could reach 250 billion US dollars in the next 5 years.

tickerNews.title: Spot Gold Price Hits New Intraday All-Time High on Safe Haven Demand and Fed Rate Cut Expectations
tickerNews.content: The gold price in the spot market briefly jumped +1.82% to the level of 4,218 US dollars per troy ounce on Wednesday (10/15) afternoon, marking a new intraday all-time high, before easing to 4,201 US dollars per troy ounce (+1.41%). This increase was supported by increasing safe haven asset demand amid expectations of a Fed interest rate cut and concerns over worsening trade relations between the US and China.

tickerNews.title: Danantara Senior Director Sunata Tjiterosampurno: Reviewing Over 50 Investment Deals, Including WTE Projects
tickerNews.content: Senior Director of Danantara, Sunata Tjiterosampurno, told Bloomberg that they are currently reviewing more than 50 investment deals, including waste-to-energy projects in 20 cities ready for evaluation by potential strategic partners this month. Sunata also added that Danantara 'should be able to deploy' a portion of its funds in the coming months. Previously, CIO of Danantara, Pandu Sjahrir, told Reuters early this month that they would invest around 10 billion US dollars or ~165 trillion rupiah in the first 3 months of operations starting from October 2025.

tickerNews.title: Allianz Global Investors Asset Management Indonesia CEO Aliyahdin Saugi on OJK Approving Higher Foreign Investment Limits for Mutual Funds
tickerNews.content: Director General of PT Allianz Global Investors Asset Management Indonesia, Aliyahdin Saugi, told Bloomberg on Tuesday (10/14) that OJK has approved the proposal submitted by the Indonesian Investment Managers Association (AMI) to raise the limit on overseas investments for the mutual fund sector in Indonesia. Currently, mutual funds in Indonesia are limited to holding no more than 15% of their net asset value abroad. The AMI proposed a new limit of 51% or more for direct equity mutual funds and 80% or higher for other mutual funds. OJK has not commented on this issue.
